comments: It appears that a(n) = (n!*h(n)) mod n, where h(n) = sum(1/k, k = 1..n). - _Gary Detlefs_, Sep 04 2010
links: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(4) = 2, a(p) = p - 1 for p prime (Wilson's_theorem), a(n) = 0 otherwise. Apart from n = 4, a(n) = (n-1)*A061007(n) = (n-1)*A010051(n).
maple: P:=proc(n) local a,i,k,w; for i from 1 by 1 to n do w:=((i-1)! mod i); print(w); od; end: P(1000); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 23 2007
crossrefs: Positive for all but the first term of A046022. Cf. A000040, A000142, A061007, A061008, A061009.
